body_html:
Btw, I experienced something similar:

In [3]: torch.dot(torch.Tensor([2, 3]).float(), torch.Tensor([2, 1]).float())
Out[3]: 0.0

➜  ~ python -c 'import torch; import os; print(os.path.dirname(torch.__file__))'
/Users/adrozdov/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch
➜  ~ otool -L  /Users/adrozdov/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/_C.cpython-36m-darwin.so
/Users/adrozdov/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/_C.cpython-36m-darwin.so:
	@rpath/libshm.dylib (compatibility version 0.0.0, current version 0.0.0)
	@rpath/libTH.1.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 1.0.0)
	@rpath/libTHS.1.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 1.0.0)
	@rpath/libTHPP.1.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 1.0.0)
	@rpath/libTHNN.1.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 1.0.0)
	@rpath/libATen.1.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 1.0.0)
	/usr/lib/libSystem.B.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 1238.60.2)
➜  ~ otool -L /Users/adrozdov/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/libTH.1.dylib
/Users/adrozdov/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/libTH.1.dylib:
	@rpath/libTH.1.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 1.0.0)
	@rpath/libmkl_intel_lp64.dylib (compatibility version 0.0.0, current version 0.0.0)
	@rpath/libmkl_intel_thread.dylib (compatibility version 0.0.0, current version 0.0.0)
	@rpath/libmkl_core.dylib (compatibility version 0.0.0, current version 0.0.0)
	@rpath/libiomp5.dylib (compatibility version 5.0.0, current version 5.0.0)
	/usr/lib/libSystem.B.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 1238.0.0)

Updating conda fixed the problem.
